profiles.name: Apple
clues: Founded in a garage by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne in 1976
Named after the fruit that inspired the founder's fruitarian diet
First computer featured a wooden case and sold for $666.66
Iconic logo was designed by Rob Janoff and originally featured a rainbow
The bite mark on the logo was added to avoid confusion with a cherry
Revolutionized personal computing with graphical user interface in 1984
Introduced the first commercially successful portable music player in 2001
Pioneered the smartphone market with a touch-screen device
Known for premium pricing and ecosystem lock-in strategy
Headquarters located in Cupertino, California
Famous for minimalist design philosophy and attention to detail
Created the world's most valuable company at various points
Annual revenue exceeds $300 billion in recent years
Known for vertical integration of hardware and software
Operating system is based on Unix kernel
Stores are known for their sleek glass architecture
One of the first tech companies to focus on user experience
Annual event showcases new products to loyal fan base
Products include computers, phones, tablets, watches, and services
Removed the headphone jack from phones in 2016

profiles.name: Coca-Cola
clues: Invented by a pharmacist named John Pemberton in Atlanta, Georgia in 1886
Originally sold at soda fountains as a medicinal tonic
Formula contains caramel coloring, carbonated water, and secret ingredients
First branded drink to receive a registered trademark in the US
Iconic contour bottle design patented in 1916
Red and white color scheme became trademark in 1969
Famous Christmas advertising campaign started in 1931
Polar bear mascots have appeared in commercials since 1993
Slogan 'Open Happiness' introduced in 2009
Now sold in more than 200 countries and territories worldwide
Contains 39 grams of sugar per 12-ounce serving
Global leader in beverage industry with diverse product portfolio
Sponsorships include Olympics and major sporting events
Founded by John Pemberton after Civil War
Stock symbol is KO on the New York Stock Exchange
Company headquarters in Atlanta, Georgia
Zero and Diet variants introduced to compete with healthier options
Distributed through network of bottling partners globally
Most consumed carbonated soft drink in the world
Annual advertising budget is among the highest in the world

profiles.name: Nike
clues: Named after the Greek goddess of victory and strength
Swoosh logo designed by a design student for $35 in 1971
Co-founded by Bill Bowerman, a track and field coach, and Phil Knight
First shoe was called the 'Moon Shoe' in 1972
Revolutionized athletic shoe design and marketing
Sponsored athletes to promote products and build brand credibility
Michael Jordan partnership created the Air Jordan line in 1984
Known for 'Just Do It' slogan since 1988
Headquarters in Beaverton, Oregon
World's largest athletic apparel and footwear manufacturer
Introduced Air technology for cushioning and comfort
First to use celebrity endorsements as primary marketing strategy
Operating in more than 190 countries worldwide
Revenue exceeds $40 billion annually
Known for innovation in materials and manufacturing
Extensive sustainability initiatives and corporate responsibility programs
Produces shoes, clothing, equipment for various sports
Retail stores feature experiential design and athlete displays
Annual convention for athletes and media called 'Innovate' series
Acquired brands like Converse and Jordan Brand to expand portfolio

profiles.name: Mercedes-Benz
clues: Invented the automobile in 1885 by Karl Benz and Gottlieb Daimler
Named after Emil Jellinek's daughter Mercedes and inventor Benz
Three-pointed star logo represents ambition to motorize transportation
Founded in Germany in 1926 through merger of two companies
Known for engineering precision and luxury features
Pioneered safety innovations like crumple zones and airbags
First mass-produced automobile with electric start in 1912
Headquarters in Stuttgart, Germany
Produces luxury sedans, SUVs, sports cars, and commercial vehicles
One of the oldest automobile manufacturers still in operation
Famous for reliability and durability standards
High price point reflects quality and prestigious brand status
Motorsports success with Formula 1 and racing programs
Introduced diesel engines to luxury segment
Known for cutting-edge technology and comfort features
Annual revenue exceeds $150 billion
Part of Daimler AG conglomerate
Global dealership network with premium service standards
Electric vehicle line called EQ launched in recent years
Iconic models include S-Class sedan and G-Class SUV

profiles.name: Disney
clues: Founded by Walt and Roy as animation studio in 1923
First animated feature film was released in 1937
Created the most famous animated character of all time in 1928
Theme parks began in California in 1955 with iconic castle landmark
Headquarters in Burbank, California
Acquired 20th Century Fox entertainment assets for $71 billion
Streaming service launched in 2019 and became industry leader
Known for storytelling that appeals to all age groups
Productions include films, television, music, and stage shows
Global entertainment giant with revenue exceeding $80 billion
Owns major franchises including Marvel and Lucasfilm
Theme parks located in multiple countries worldwide
Known for family-friendly content and wholesome values
Stock symbol is DIS on the New York Stock Exchange
ABC television network is part of the company
Employees are called 'Cast Members' not workers
Cinematic universe strategy connects multiple film franchises
Known for elaborate parades and spectacular shows
Merchandise and licensing generates significant revenue
Recently became the largest media and entertainment company globally
